summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Logs for August 9, 2019. It details routine prison operations, counts, staff shortages, and equipment status. The document is significant as it provides a detailed snapshot of the prison's operational environment on the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell (August 10, 2019), including mentions of inmates on suicide watch and in a dry cell.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Monitoring
events.description: Routine prison activities including inmate counts, body alarm testing, equipment checks, staff assignments, and monitoring of inmates on suicide watch and in a dry cell.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate was placed on a dry cell in the Receiving and Discharge (R&D) holding cell with a staff watch, as noted in the Evening Watch Shift log.

events.title: Multiple Inmates on Suicide Watch
events.description: The logs repeatedly note inmates on suicide watch, some with inmate companions, throughout the day across all three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch).

events.title: Treaty Transfer Return
events.description: A treaty transfer return occurred at 3:03 AM after a flight was canceled due to mechanical problems, increasing the inmate count by one.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a prison operations log for August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
It records multiple inmates on suicide watch with inmate companions and one inmate placed in a dry cell under staff watch.
The log notes chronic staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments and an inoperative Control Center Fire Panel.
Inmate movements, counts, and routine security checks (body alarms, metal detectors, roof checks) are meticulously documented throughout three shifts.
The document provides context about the prison's operational state and security protocols immediately preceding Epstein's death.
